segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine。

segments.en: And today we're going to be helping you find someone to help out around the house.
segments.cn: 今天我们将帮助你找到可以在家里帮忙的人。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we're looking for someone to help us do some things around the house.
segments.cn: 我们正在寻找可以帮助我们做一些家务的人。

segments.en: So we're going to talk about this more in depth.
segments.cn: 所以我们将更深入地讨论这个话题。

segments.en: But first, let's take a look at one word on vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 但首先，让我们看一个词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 词汇预览。

segments.en: So the beginning of today's dialogue has to do with a newspaper ad.
segments.cn: 今天对话的开头与一则报纸广告有关。

segments.en: We are writing an ad for the newspaper.
segments.cn: 我们正在为报纸写一则广告。

segments.en: Now, what exactly is a newspaper ad, Marco?
segments.cn: Marco，报纸广告到底是什么？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So in the newspapers, usually there is a section called the classifieds, where people post ads or advertisements or adverts, where maybe they're selling their car or they're looking to hire people.
segments.cn: 在报纸上，通常有一个叫做分类广告的部分，人们在这里发布广告，可能是出售汽车或寻找雇佣人员。

segments.en: So this is what a newspaper ad is.
segments.cn: 这就是报纸广告。

segments.en: You're selling something, you're buying something, or maybe you want to hire people, etc.
segments.cn: 你在出售东西，购买东西，或者可能想雇佣人等。

segments.en: It is basically an advertisement in the newspaper to find help.
segments.cn: 基本上就是在报纸上寻找帮助的广告。

segments.en: Alright, so let's listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们来听听我们的对话。

segments.en: And when we come back, we'll be talking more about the words and phrases you've heard.
segments.cn: 回来后，我们将讨论你听到的单词和短语。

segments.en: Can you help me write a newspaper ad?
segments.cn: 你能帮我写一则报纸广告吗？

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: What are you looking to buy or sell?
segments.cn: 你想买或卖什么？

segments.en: Actually, I want to hire someone to help me around the house.
segments.cn: 实际上，我想雇一个人来帮我做家务。

segments.en: Oh, you want to get a maid?
segments.cn: 哦，你想请个女佣？

segments.en: Well, I think it's better if you call her a cleaning lady or domestic help.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得叫她清洁工或家务助理更好。

segments.en: Okay, so what do you want her to do?
segments.cn: 好的，那你想让她做什么？

segments.en: Well, let's see.
segments.cn: 嗯，让我想想。

segments.en: I want her to come in three times a week for a couple of hours to clean the kitchen, bathroom, and maybe do some cooking.
segments.cn: 我想让她每周来三次，待几个小时，清理厨房、浴室，可能还做点饭。

segments.en: Got it.
segments.cn: 明白了。

segments.en: And how much do you offer per month?
segments.cn: 那你每月提供多少钱？

segments.en: I would pay her hourly.
segments.cn: 我会按小时支付她。

segments.en: I don't know what the going rate is, though.
segments.cn: 不过我不知道现在的行情是多少。

segments.en: I know for sure it's more than minimum wage, but maybe you should just negotiate with the person that answers the ad.
segments.cn: 我知道肯定超过最低工资，但也许你应该和回复广告的人谈判。

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: Thanks for your help.
segments.cn: 谢谢你的帮助。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Okay, so first of all, today, Marco, the advertisement is about wanting to hire someone.
segments.cn: 好的，首先，Marco，今天的广告是关于想要雇佣某人的。

segments.en: Now, this is an important verb, especially when we're trying to find help.
segments.cn: 这是一个重要的动词，尤其是在我们寻找帮助时。

segments.en: The verb to hire.
segments.cn: 动词“雇佣”。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So to hire means to give someone work, to offer a contract to someone.
segments.cn: 雇佣意味着给某人工作，向某人提供合同。

segments.en: Okay, so my boss hired me three years ago.
segments.cn: 好的，我的老板三年前雇了我。

segments.en: That means he gave me a job three years ago.
segments.cn: 这意味着他三年前给了我一份工作。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But this is not just for office jobs.
segments.cn: 但这不仅仅适用于办公室工作。

segments.en: This is for all kinds of jobs.
segments.cn: 这适用于各种工作。

segments.en: So what about cutting your grass or doing your lawn?
segments.cn: 那么割草或修剪草坪呢？

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So you can hire a gardener, for example.
segments.cn: 例如，你可以雇一个园丁。

segments.en: And it's basically the same thing.
segments.cn: 基本上是一样的。

segments.en: It means that you're going to pay someone to work for you.
segments.cn: 这意味着你将支付某人为你工作。

segments.en: Okay, so today we wanted to hire a maid.
segments.cn: 好的，今天我们想雇一个女佣。

segments.en: M-A-I-D.
segments.cn: M-A-I-D。

segments.en: A maid.
segments.cn: 一个女佣。

segments.en: But this is a little bit old-fashioned, this word.
segments.cn: 但这个词有点过时。

segments.en: What does a maid do?
segments.cn: 女佣做什么？

segments.en: Or what did a maid do?
segments.cn: 或者女佣曾经做什么？

segments.en: Well, a maid is basically a woman, a female servant, so to say.
segments.cn: 嗯，女佣基本上是一个女性仆人。

segments.en: A person that basically serves you.
segments.cn: 基本上是一个为你服务的人。

segments.en: All right, so she cleans the house.
segments.cn: 好的，她打扫房子。

segments.en: She maybe puts the covers on the beds, washes the dishes, cooks.
segments.cn: 她可能会铺床、洗碗、做饭。

segments.en: Does all of these domestic things, so she works around the house.
segments.cn: 做所有这些家务，所以她在家里工作。

segments.en: But because there's a bad association, we don't like to think, oh, we have servants.
segments.cn: 但因为有不好的联想，我们不喜欢认为我们有仆人。

segments.en: We don't say maid anymore.
segments.cn: 我们不再说女佣。

segments.en: We have two other ways of saying this word.
segments.cn: 我们有两种其他说法。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So we could say that we want to hire a cleaning lady, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们可以说我们想雇一个清洁工，对吧？

segments.en: Or we want to hire domestic help.
segments.cn: 或者我们想雇家务助理。

segments.en: Okay, now there's an important difference between these two words.
segments.cn: 好的，现在这两个词之间有一个重要的区别。

segments.en: First of all, cleaning lady is a woman, a lady.
segments.cn: 首先，清洁工是一个女性，一个女士。

segments.en: And she is someone who only cleans.
segments.cn: 她是专门负责清洁的。

segments.en: She doesn't take care of your children.
segments.cn: 她不照顾你的孩子。

segments.en: She doesn't walk your dog.
segments.cn: 她不遛你的狗。

segments.en: She basically just cleans the house, washes the dishes, cleans the clothes, washes the floors.
segments.cn: 她基本上只打扫房子，洗碗，洗衣服，拖地。

segments.en: So she's a cleaning lady.
segments.cn: 所以她是一个清洁工。

segments.en: Now, domestic help.
segments.cn: 现在，家务助理。

segments.en: This is a little bit more general.
segments.cn: 这更为广泛一些。

segments.en: Right, so domestic help would be a little bit more in-depth of what the person's going to do.
segments.cn: 对，所以家务助理会更深入地涉及这个人将要做的事情。

segments.en: So will help with the domestic work.
segments.cn: 所以会帮助处理家务。

segments.en: Domestic meaning the house.
segments.cn: 家务意味着家庭。

segments.en: So this person will maybe cook for you, clean the house, take care of the kids, do everything that is associated with the house.
segments.cn: 所以这个人可能会为你做饭，打扫房子，照顾孩子，做与家庭相关的所有事情。

segments.en: So it's important to see that domestic means something that has to do with the house.
segments.cn: 所以重要的是要看到家务意味着与家庭有关的事情。

segments.en: So this is help man or woman in the house.
segments.cn: 所以这是在家里帮助的男人或女人。

segments.en: Alright, so that's all we have for Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们关于语言要点的全部内容。

segments.en: But we do have another section, Fluency Builder, in which we're going to look at some great words and phrases.
segments.cn: 但我们还有另一个部分，流利度提升，在这里我们将看看一些很棒的单词和短语。

segments.en: Alright, so first on Fluency Builder, let's take a look at how we're going to pay the person.
segments.cn: 好的，首先在流利度提升中，让我们看看我们将如何支付这个人。

segments.en: Because obviously we were saying that we want to hire this person, we're going to pay them.
segments.cn: 因为显然我们在说我们想雇这个人，我们将支付他们。

segments.en: So how are we going to pay them?
segments.cn: 那我们将如何支付他们？

segments.en: The person said, I would pay the woman her hourly.
segments.cn: 这个人说，我会按小时支付这个女人。

segments.en: I would pay her hourly.
segments.cn: 我会按小时支付她。

segments.en: Okay, so this is the rate.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是费率。

segments.en: This is how much she will be paid.
segments.cn: 这就是她将获得的报酬。

segments.en: And we don't say she will be paid $10,000 per year, we say she will be paid $10 per hour.
segments.cn: 我们不说她每年将获得$10,000，而是说她每小时将获得$10。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So we pay per hour.
segments.cn: 所以我们按小时支付。

segments.en: This is paying her hourly.
segments.cn: 这就是按小时支付她。

segments.en: Right, so if you have an hourly wage, that means that you get paid per hour.
segments.cn: 对，所以如果你有一个小时工资，那意味着你是按小时支付的。

segments.en: In contrast with a salary, that means that you would get a fixed amount every month.
segments.cn: 与薪水相对，那意味着你每个月会获得固定的金额。

segments.en: Alright, so if the monthly salary is $1,000, for example, you could break that down and say, but every day you earn $100, you work 10 days.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果月薪是$1,000，例如，你可以分解说，但每天你赚$100，你工作10天。

segments.en: But if it's hourly, you say you'll get paid $10 per hour.
segments.cn: 但如果是按小时计算，你说你会得到每小时10美元。

segments.en: So if you work 4 hours today, you will earn $40.
segments.cn: 所以如果你今天工作4小时，你将赚40美元。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so now we want to pay the cleaning lady hourly, but we don't know what the going rate is.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们想按小时支付清洁工，但我们不知道当前的收费标准。

segments.en: Going rate.
segments.cn: 当前收费标准。

segments.en: Going.
segments.cn: 当前。

segments.en: So this is an interesting phrase, and it's important to notice that it's not...
segments.cn: 这是一个有趣的短语，重要的是要注意它并不是...

segments.en: going rate is an amount of money, but it's not always the same.
segments.cn: 当前收费标准是一个金额，但并不总是相同。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: It depends on the industry.
segments.cn: 这取决于行业。

segments.en: So the going rate for a teacher is different from the going rate for a cleaning lady, which is different from the going rate for a language tutor, or like an English tutor.
segments.cn: 所以教师的收费标准与清洁工的收费标准不同，语言辅导员或英语辅导员的收费标准又不同。

segments.en: So, first of all, the going rate is how much these people, these cleaning ladies, normally earn.
segments.cn: 首先，当前收费标准是这些人，清洁工，通常赚多少钱。

segments.en: It's an average.
segments.cn: 这是一个平均值。

segments.en: Right, so you would usually calculate it, say, the approximate going rate is between maybe $8 to $10 per hour.
segments.cn: 对，所以你通常会计算，大约的收费标准在每小时8到10美元之间。

segments.en: So it's not like an exact amount.
segments.cn: 所以这不是一个确切的金额。

segments.en: You would say the going rate is more or less a certain amount.
segments.cn: 你会说当前收费标准大致是某个金额。

segments.en: It's not exact.
segments.cn: 这不是确切的。

segments.en: So you might ask your friends, what do you pay your cleaning lady?
segments.cn: 所以你可能会问你的朋友，你给你的清洁工支付多少？

segments.en: And one friend says, oh, I pay $12 per hour.
segments.cn: 一位朋友说，哦，我支付每小时12美元。

segments.en: And my other friend says, oh, I pay about $8 per hour.
segments.cn: 另一位朋友说，哦，我支付每小时大约8美元。

segments.en: So to me, it sounds like the going rate is about $10 per hour.
segments.cn: 所以对我来说，听起来当前收费标准大约是每小时10美元。

segments.en: Right, exactly.
segments.cn: 对，正是如此。

segments.en: So we're not really sure what the going rate is.
segments.cn: 所以我们并不确定当前收费标准是什么。

segments.en: So our friend says, well, you know what?
segments.cn: 所以我们的朋友说，好吧，你知道吗？

segments.en: I'm sure it's more than minimum wage.
segments.cn: 我相信这比最低工资要高。

segments.en: Now, minimum wage is actually something that the government decides on or either the federal government in America or the state.
segments.cn: 现在，最低工资实际上是由政府决定的，或者是美国的联邦政府或州政府。

segments.en: And each state will have a number that they say that is the least you can pay a person per hour.
segments.cn: 每个州都会有一个数字，表示每小时你可以支付给一个人的最低金额。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: So it is the law.
segments.cn: 所以这是法律。

segments.en: If you pay less... It's illegal.
segments.cn: 如果你支付更少... 这是非法的。

segments.en: It's illegal.
segments.cn: 这是非法的。

segments.en: And this is because we expect everyone to be treated fairly.
segments.cn: 这是因为我们期望每个人都能得到公平对待。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: So you don't want to take advantage of people.
segments.cn: 所以你不想利用别人。

segments.en: No.
segments.cn: 不。

segments.en: And so, for example, in America, in my state, Illinois, I think the minimum wage is $7.25 per hour.
segments.cn: 例如，在美国，在我的州，伊利诺伊州，我认为最低工资是每小时7.25美元。

segments.en: Oh, really?
segments.cn: 哦，真的吗？

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: It's pretty high.
segments.cn: 这很高。

segments.en: And this is because people need to pay for health care and cars and houses and children.
segments.cn: 这是因为人们需要支付医疗保健、汽车、房子和孩子的费用。

segments.en: So we say the least you can pay someone is $7.25.
segments.cn: 所以我们说你可以支付给某人的最低金额是7.25美元。

segments.en: Now, this is different.
segments.cn: 现在，这个是不同的。

segments.en: As you said, it could be different from state to state, right?
segments.cn: 正如你所说，这可能因州而异，对吧？

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: Because I know in some states, if I'm not mistaken, it's like $5.50 or something.
segments.cn: 因为我知道在某些州，如果我没记错的话，可能是5.50美元左右。

segments.en: Yeah, some states it's $5.
segments.cn: 是的，有些州是5美元。

segments.en: It depends on the cost of living.
segments.cn: 这取决于生活成本。

segments.en: If it's cheap to rent an apartment or to find transportation, then obviously the minimum wage is going to be lower.
segments.cn: 如果租公寓或找交通便宜，那么显然最低工资会更低。

segments.en: Obviously, there's no maximum wage.
segments.cn: 显然，没有最高工资。

segments.en: There's no number that is the most you can pay someone.
segments.cn: 没有一个是你可以支付给某人的最高金额。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，对。

segments.en: But all states have a minimum wage.
segments.cn: 但所有州都有最低工资。

segments.en: It's the least that you can pay someone per hour.
segments.cn: 这是你每小时可以支付给某人的最低金额。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: And now for our last phrase, we don't know what the minimum wage is.
segments.cn: 现在对于我们的最后一句话，我们不知道最低工资是什么。

segments.en: We're not really sure what the going rate is.
segments.cn: 我们并不确定当前收费标准是什么。

segments.en: So we should just negotiate with the person that answers the ad.
segments.cn: 所以我们应该与回复广告的人谈判。

segments.en: All right, now, to negotiate is a great verb.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在，谈判是一个很好的动词。

segments.en: It is something that all of us do all the time.
segments.cn: 这是我们所有人一直在做的事情。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So to negotiate means to try and compromise.
segments.cn: 所以谈判意味着尝试妥协。

segments.en: To reach an agreement.
segments.cn: 达成协议。

segments.en: And so maybe I say, the most I will pay is $11.
segments.cn: 所以也许我说，我最多支付11美元。

segments.en: So I say, okay, I'll pay you $9.
segments.cn: 所以我说，好吧，我支付你9美元。

segments.en: And I say, no, I'll take $12.
segments.cn: 我说，不，我要12美元。

segments.en: Yeah, sorry, $12 is too much.
segments.cn: 是的，抱歉，12美元太多了。

segments.en: I'll pay you $10.
segments.cn: 我支付你10美元。

segments.en: Okay, $11.
segments.cn: 好吧，11美元。
11美元？

segments.en: Okay, agreed.
segments.cn: 好的，达成协议。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: So it's a way of reaching an agreement, like you say, where both sides have their goals.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种达成协议的方式，就像你说的，双方都有他们的目标。

segments.en: And they try to find a price that is the best for both parties.
segments.cn: 他们试图找到一个对双方都最好的价格。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So it's basically a verb to negotiate, and this is what you do, as you said, in many circumstances.
segments.cn: 所以这基本上是一个动词，谈判，这就是你在许多情况下所做的。

segments.en: Especially when you're getting a job.
segments.cn: 尤其是在你找工作的时候。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: All right, so let's listen to the dialogue one last time, and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以让我们最后再听一遍对话，我们稍后会回来。

segments.en: Can you help me write a newspaper ad?
segments.cn: 你能帮我写一则报纸广告吗？

segments.en: Sure.
segments.cn: 当然。

segments.en: What are you looking to buy or sell?
segments.cn: 你想买或卖什么？

segments.en: Actually, I want to hire someone to help me around the house.
segments.cn: 实际上，我想雇人帮我打理家务。

segments.en: Oh, you want to get a maid?
segments.cn: 哦，你想找个女佣？

segments.en: Well, I think it's better if you call her a cleaning lady or domestic help.
segments.cn: 嗯，我觉得叫她清洁工或家政服务更好。

segments.en: Okay, so what do you want her to do?
segments.cn: 好的，那你想让她做什么？

segments.en: Well, let's see.
segments.cn: 嗯，让我想想。

segments.en: I want her to come in three times a week for a couple of hours to clean the kitchen, bathroom, and maybe do some cooking.
segments.cn: 我想让她每周来三次，待几个小时，清理厨房、浴室，可能还做些饭。

segments.en: Got it.
segments.cn: 明白了。

segments.en: And how much do you offer per month?
segments.cn: 那你每月提供多少？

segments.en: I would pay her hourly.
segments.cn: 我会按小时支付她。

segments.en: I don't know what the going rate is, though.
segments.cn: 不过我不知道当前的收费标准是多少。

segments.en: I know for sure it's more than minimum wage, but maybe you should just negotiate with the person that answers the ad.
segments.cn: 我确定这比最低工资要高，但也许你应该与回复广告的人谈判。

segments.en: Great.
segments.cn: 太好了。

segments.en: Thanks for your help.
segments.cn: 谢谢你的帮助。

segments.en: Alright, so talking about minimum wage, is there any exception to why a person would earn less than minimum wage?
segments.cn: 好吧，谈到最低工资，有没有什么例外情况，为什么一个人会赚得少于最低工资？

segments.en: I don't believe so.
segments.cn: 我不相信有。

segments.en: Well, if they're not legally employed, right?
segments.cn: 嗯，如果他们没有合法就业，对吧？

segments.en: So if you're talking about people who we say are under the table, working under the table, that means that they're not working legally.
segments.cn: 所以如果你说的是我们所说的“黑工”，在黑市工作，那意味着他们没有合法工作。

segments.en: They're not paying taxes.
segments.cn: 他们没有缴税。

segments.en: Then maybe those people will be paid less.
segments.cn: 那么也许那些人会得到更少的报酬。

segments.en: What about waiters and waitresses?
segments.cn: 服务员和女服务员呢？

segments.en: I've heard that they earn less than minimum wage, but because they earn tips.
segments.cn: 我听说他们的收入低于最低工资，但因为他们会有小费。

segments.en: This is true.
segments.cn: 这是真的。

segments.en: So most restaurants say, okay, we will pay you as a waiter $3 an hour, but because you will earn tips, you will earn more than the minimum wage.
segments.cn: 所以大多数餐馆会说，好吧，我们会支付你每小时3美元的服务员工资，但因为你会赚小费，你的收入会超过最低工资。

segments.en: So this is a good exception.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个好的例外。

segments.en: Unfortunately, there's no promise.
segments.cn: 不幸的是，没有保证。

segments.en: If you have no customers, you earn no tips, so you're still earning less than minimum wage.
segments.cn: 如果你没有顾客，你就赚不到小费，所以你仍然赚得低于最低工资。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: But it's possible that you also have many, many customers, and you earn lots of tips, and you make $15 an hour or something much higher than the minimum wage.
segments.cn: 但也有可能你有很多顾客，赚了很多小费，赚到每小时15美元或更高的工资。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And actually, being a waiter or a waitress is a very common job that a lot of people have when they're still in school or over the summer.
segments.cn: 实际上，做服务员是很多人在上学或暑假时常见的工作。

segments.en: And I've heard that it could be quite good because Americans are pretty good tippers.
segments.cn: 我听说这可能相当不错，因为美国人通常给小费。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Americans generally tip between 15 and 20 percent.
segments.cn: 美国人一般给15%到20%的小费。

segments.en: And you know that you have to tip because your waiter does not earn a minimum wage.
segments.cn: 你知道你必须给小费，因为你的服务员没有最低工资。

segments.en: Right.
segments.cn: 对。

segments.en: So you're conscious about that.
segments.cn: 所以你对此很有意识。

segments.en: So if your bill comes out to like $100, then you are most definitely going to leave at least a $20 tip.
segments.cn: 所以如果你的账单是100美元，那么你肯定会至少留下20美元的小费。

segments.en: Usually, yeah, $15 to $20.
segments.cn: 通常是的，15到20美元。

segments.en: $20 if it's that much money.
segments.cn: 如果金额这么多，就给20美元。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: Wow.
segments.cn: 哇。

segments.en: That's very, very interesting, especially considering that in many countries, tipping is not really considered...
segments.cn: 这非常有趣，尤其是考虑到在许多国家，小费并不被认为是...

segments.en: It's not expected or it's not really something that people do.
segments.cn: 这不是被期待的，或者人们并不真的这样做。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: And in America, it is something that you have to do.
segments.cn: 在美国，这是你必须做的事情。

segments.en: So I think a lot of times when people come to America, they don't expect to pay this.
segments.cn: 所以我认为很多人来到美国时，并不期望支付这些。

segments.en: There's tax, there's tip.
segments.cn: 有税，还有小费。

segments.en: So when you see a menu, remember that the cost is a lot higher than what you see.
segments.cn: 所以当你看到菜单时，记住成本比你看到的要高得多。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: Very, very interesting topic.
segments.cn: 非常有趣的话题。

segments.en: Let us know if you have any questions, any doubts or comments.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题、疑虑或评论，请告诉我们。

segments.en: You can find us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 你可以在EnglishPod.com找到我们。

segments.en: We'll see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们在那里见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。

segments.en: Bye.
segments.cn: 再见。
